intro: Tambourissa thouvenotii, commonly known as the Madagascar trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture, and it produces fleshy, berry-like fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
